intro: Murdannia assamica, commonly known as the Assam murdannia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has elongated, narrow leaves. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Murdannia assamica is often found in swampy habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
